messages.subject: Re: diary sensitivity.
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/24/99 12:04:05 PM Central Daylight Time, Buresmom@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/24/99 12:04:05 PM Central Daylight Time,
Buresmom@... writes:

<< Tami, try acidophilus milk. It is easier to digest and it tastes the same.
It may help. Worth a try anyway. >>
Both my kids are allergic to dairy--we tried lactaid--that might work for
you. Also soy milk--There is a product called Silk-it's in the dairy case,
that both my kids love. >>


Mary and Debra,
These are both good suggestions. Thank you!
Tami

messages.subject: Re: diary sensitivity.
messages.msgSnippet: Tami, try acidophilus milk. It is easier to digest and it tastes the same. It may help. Worth a try anyway. Mary in Idaho
messages.messageBody:
Tami, try acidophilus milk. It is easier to digest and it tastes the same.
It may help. Worth a try anyway.

Mary in Idaho

messages.subject: Re: diary sensitivity.
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 09/24/1999 12:16:12 PM Eastern Daylight Time, mrstar@gateway.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 09/24/1999 12:16:12 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
mrstar@... writes:

<<
Tami, try acidophilus milk. It is easier to digest and it tastes the same.
It may help. Worth a try anyway. >>
Both my kids are allergic to dairy--we tried lactaid--that might work for
you. Also soy milk--There is a product called Silk-it's in the dairy case,
that both my kids love. One will drink soy milk, the other vanilla rice
dream(enriched), I bake with soy milk, though. It's much more like cow's
milk, and you can add a little lemon to make "buttermilk"
Debra
